Poetic Translation: Get up now, Pascual, get up now!

Direct Translation: Let's take our flock to Granada,
Poetic Translation: The flock -- to Granada lead it,

Direct Translation: For it sounds like it's taken.
Poetic Translation: For they say it’s been defeated.
Get up, move quickly, and hustle.

Direct Translation: Take your dog and your pouch,
Poetic Translation: Take your old dog and your poke,
Get your sheepskin and cloak,

Direct Translation: Your shawm and your shepherd's crook.
Poetic Translation: Your shawm and crook: Move your muscles!
Let’s go see the merry bustle
In the city of fame repeated,

Direct Translation: For it sounds like it's taken.
Poetic Translation: For they say it’s been defeated.

Direct Translation: I know you think you've fooled me.
Poetic Translation: Looks like you think you can fool me.

Direct Translation: I swear you're pulling my leg!
Poetic Translation: Don’t you think I can see through you?

Direct Translation: If you want it so much,
Poetic Translation: Even more, I’ll bet, than you do,
I wish it were fallen truly.
So far, no one’s given, you’ll see,
The proof that their story needed

Direct Translation: For it sounds like it's taken.
Poetic Translation: When they said it’s been defeated.
Oh, for God’s sake, Heaven bless it;

Direct Translation: You always think I'm lying to you!
Poetic Translation: You always think that I’m lying!
I’m sorry for even trying;

Lyrics: porque a ti nada te digo!
Poetic Translation: Next time I’ll just make you guess it!
Move; get up; let’s go and test it:
Quickly come, as I’ve entreated,

Direct Translation: For it sounds like it's taken.
Poetic Translation: For they say it’s been defeated.
Better to think of our duty:

Direct Translation: Let's take good care of our cattle,
Poetic Translation: We’d better tend to the cattle,

Lyrics: no se meta en lo vedado,
Direct Translation: So they don't wander into forbidden territory
Poetic Translation: Or they’ll wander toward the battle,

Direct Translation: And make us get caught by some Moor.
Poetic Translation: And turn into Moorish booty.
Let’s pipe up a tune of beauty;

Lyrics: porque todo lo otro es nada.
Poetic Translation: All this gossip should go unheeded,

Direct Translation: For it sounds like it's taken.
Poetic Translation: Though they say it’s been defeated.
Well, let the livestock go wander;
Let them go wander a ways.
It’s safe already to graze;
In quiet peace they can maunder.
Look now toward the sky out yonder:

Direct Translation: See how much smoke there is,
Poetic Translation: See the smoke that climbs to meet it.

Direct Translation: For it sounds like it's taken.
Poetic Translation: As they say, it’s been defeated.

Direct Translation: O king and queen so blessed!
Poetic Translation: Queen and king of faith undoubted!
Come on, let’s go, for I perceive it,
And I already believe it.
Let’s go now, just as you’ve shouted,
To trade our goats to the routed

Direct Translation: Because there will be a gilded sale,
Poetic Translation: And buy gold spoils that they’ve ceded,

Direct Translation: For it sounds like it's taken.
Poetic Translation: For they say it’s been defeated.
O cow-man, listen neatly,

Direct Translation: I will tell you a wonder:
Poetic Translation: I will tell you of a wonder:
How that famous town went under

Lyrics: según dizen, no ha gran rato.
Direct Translation: As they say, in a short while.
Poetic Translation: With force shattering and speedy.

Direct Translation: Oh, who has seen such a great treaty
Poetic Translation: Oh, who’s seen such a great treaty

Direct Translation: As there was at the time it was delivered!
Poetic Translation: As when city and victors treated,

Direct Translation: For it sounds like it's taken.
Poetic Translation: For they say it’s been defeated?

Direct Translation: Tell me, tell me the news,
Poetic Translation: Hearing this, I’m feeling giddy;

Direct Translation: For I am enjoying myself very much,
Poetic Translation: Tell me the details I can treasure,

Direct Translation: But I will take no rest
Poetic Translation: But I will not loaf in leisure

Direct Translation: Until you take me and we arrive.
Poetic Translation: Till we’ve arrived at the city.
Young man, you are prudent and witty!

Direct Translation: God has given us a good day's work,
Poetic Translation: We thank God Spain has succeeded,

Direct Translation: For it sounds like it's taken.
Poetic Translation: For they say it’s been defeated.

Direct Translation: I'll tell you how it was:
Poetic Translation: Really it happened this way:

Lyrics: que nuestra reina y el rey,
Direct Translation: How our queen and the king,
Poetic Translation: Our queen and our king, shining gold
Like stars in the faith we hold,
Both rode out from Santa Fe.
They rode forth in early day;

Direct Translation: They say it was before dawn.
Poetic Translation: Dawn from the highway they greeted,

Direct Translation: For it sounds like it's taken.
Poetic Translation: And they say it’s been defeated.

Direct Translation: Then they will all be there,
Poetic Translation: With all our host in massed collection
The city now must teeming be,
Filled with great solemnity
And songs and joyous connection.
The Gothic line’s perfection,

Direct Translation: Our king and queen of famous glory!
Poetic Translation: Sovereigns with glory completed!

Direct Translation: For it sounds like it's taken.
Poetic Translation: For they say it’s been defeated.
To our eyes, what consolation:

Direct Translation: To see on towers and gates
Poetic Translation: On each turret and each tower
Is raised the Cross of power!
What a relief! What elation!
The Court in splendid formation
Through Granada’s gates proceeded,

Direct Translation: For it sounds like it's taken.
Poetic Translation: And they say it’s been defeated.
Carol Anne Perry Lagemann
